questions.questionText: Which of the following best describes the trade-off when using a CSS framework like Bootstrap versus custom CSS?
What is the most likely consequence if an HTML tag is not properly closed?
options: The browser will not display the page
The page will display with unexpected layout issues
The server will return an error
questions.correctAnswer: The page will display with unexpected layout issues

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the xhr.onreadystatechange event handler in AJAX?
options: It sends the request to the server
It checks if the server response is ready
It handles errors in the request
questions.correctAnswer: It checks if the server response is ready

questions.questionText: Why do we check both xhr.readyState === 4 and xhr.status === 200 in AJAX?
options: To ensure the request is complete and successful
To check if the server is available
questions.correctAnswer: To ensure the request is complete and successful

questions.questionText: In an AJAX POST request, what does xhr.send('username=John&password=123456') do?
options: Sends the data as query parameters
Sends the data in the request body
Encodes the data in the URL
questions.correctAnswer: Sends the data in the request body

questions.questionText: What is a key benefit of using React for building user interfaces?
options: It uses a virtual DOM for efficient updates
questions.correctAnswer: It uses a virtual DOM for efficient updates

questions.questionText: What is a potential drawback of using React?
options: It has a steep learning curve for beginners
It does not support component-based architecture
It requires a lot of boilerplate code
It is not suitable for large applications
questions.correctAnswer: It has a steep learning curve for beginners

questions.questionText: What advantage does React offer compared to vanilla JavaScript?
options: Easier state management for complex UIs
questions.correctAnswer: Easier state management for complex UIs

questions.questionText: What is a disadvantage of using React compared to vanilla JavaScript?
options: It requires additional build tools and setup
It cannot manipulate the DOM directly
It does not support event handling
It is slower for simple static pages
questions.correctAnswer: It requires additional build tools and setup

questions.questionText: What is a common challenge when integrating an external API into your code?
options: Handling rate limits and API keys
questions.correctAnswer: Handling rate limits and API keys

questions.questionText: What is an advantage of using JSON over XML?
options: JSON is better for complex data structures

questions.questionText: What is a disadvantage of JSON compared to XML?
options: JSON is not supported by web browsers

questions.questionText: What is the primary purpose of using AJAX for server-client communication?
options: To load data without refreshing the page
To validate user input on the client side
To store data locally in the browser
To enhance the styling of web pages
questions.correctAnswer: To load data without refreshing the page

questions.questionText: Why should CSS and JavaScript be used as separate files instead of embedded in HTML?
options: It allows for better code organization and reusability
It makes the HTML file smaller
It improves the security of the application
It enables faster parsing by the browser
questions.correctAnswer: It allows for better code organization and reusability

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a standard method for validating an email address in a signup form?
options: Checking if the domain has an MX record

questions.questionText: What is the full name of URL?
Which option correctly lists four components of a URL?
What happens if a .php file is opened directly from the file system in a browser?
What is the primary role of the HTTP protocol in applications?
What is the main function of the TCP protocol?
options: To provide reliable, ordered delivery of data packets
To resolve domain names to IP addresses
To compress data for faster transmission
To authenticate users on a network
questions.correctAnswer: To provide reliable, ordered delivery of data packets

questions.questionText: What is the primary role of the DNS protocol?
options: It translates domain names to IP addresses
questions.correctAnswer: It translates domain names to IP addresses

questions.questionText: If an element’s dimensions are specified as (800x600), what are its width and height?
Which of the following is not commonly used for web application development?
Which HTTP code indicates a successful response from a server?
What happens when an empty HTML file is opened in a web browser?
In CSS, which selector has the highest specificity?
Which statement about JavaScript is not true?
options: JavaScript supports client-side and server-side development
JavaScript is executed by the web browser

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the <meta> tag in HTML?
options: To provide metadata about the document
questions.correctAnswer: To provide metadata about the document

questions.questionText: In JavaScript, what is the purpose of the 'addEventListener' method?
options: To attach an event handler to an element
questions.correctAnswer: To attach an event handler to an element

questions.questionText: What does the CSS property 'display: none' do?
options: Hides an element from the page
questions.correctAnswer: Hides an element from the page

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the 'alt' attribute in an HTML tag?
options: To provide alternative text for accessibility
To add a border to the image
questions.correctAnswer: To provide alternative text for accessibility

questions.questionText: Which CSS property is used to control the spacing between elements?
In JavaScript, what does the 'this' keyword refer to in a method of an object?
What is the default value of the CSS 'position' property?
Which HTTP method is typically used to retrieve data from a server?
In React, what is the purpose of the 'useState' hook?
options: To fetch data from an API

questions.questionText: What does the JavaScript 'async' keyword do when used with a function?
options: Makes the function return a Promise
questions.correctAnswer: Makes the function return a Promise

questions.questionText: Which of the following is a valid way to include an external CSS file in HTML?
What is the purpose of the 'CORS' policy in web browsers?
In JavaScript, what does the 'map' method do when called on an array?
options: Filters elements based on a condition
Creates a new array with transformed elements
questions.correctAnswer: Creates a new array with transformed elements

questions.questionText: Which HTML element is used to define a navigation section?
What is the role of the 'key' prop in React when rendering a list of components?
options: To uniquely identify elements for efficient updates
questions.correctAnswer: To uniquely identify elements for efficient updates

questions.questionText: Which CSS unit is relative to the font size of the root element?
What does the JavaScript 'fetch' API primarily do?
options: Makes HTTP requests to retrieve resources
questions.correctAnswer: Makes HTTP requests to retrieve resources

questions.questionText: Which of the following is NOT a valid JavaScript data type?
What is the purpose of the HTML 'data-' attribute?
options: To store custom data for scripting
questions.correctAnswer: To store custom data for scripting

questions.questionText: In CSS, what does the 'flex' shorthand property define?
Which status code indicates that a resource was not found on the server?
In React, what is a 'component'?
What is the purpose of the 'viewport' meta tag in HTML?
options: To control responsive design for mobile devices
questions.correctAnswer: To control responsive design for mobile devices

questions.questionText: Which HTML tag is used to define an unordered list?
What does the CSS 'z-index' property control?
In JavaScript, what is the purpose of the 'setTimeout' function?
options: To execute a function after a delay
questions.correctAnswer: To execute a function after a delay

questions.questionText: Which CSS property is used to create rounded corners on an element?
What is the purpose of the 'Content-Type' header in an HTTP request?
options: To specify the format of the request body
To set the response status code
questions.correctAnswer: To specify the format of the request body

questions.questionText: In React, what does the 'useEffect' hook do?
options: Handles side effects like data fetching
questions.correctAnswer: Handles side effects like data fetching

questions.questionText: Which JavaScript method is used to convert a JSON string into an object?
What is the default display value for a <div> element in CSS?
Which HTTP method is used to update an existing resource on a server?
In JavaScript, what does the 'spread operator' (...) do?
Which HTML attribute specifies a unique identifier for an element?
What is the purpose of the CSS 'transition' property?
options: To animate changes in property values
questions.correctAnswer: To animate changes in property values

questions.questionText: In React, what is a 'prop' used for?
Which JavaScript event is triggered when a user clicks an element?
What does the CSS 'box-sizing: border-box' property do?
options: Includes padding and border in element's width
questions.correctAnswer: Includes padding and border in element's width

questions.questionText: Which protocol is commonly used for secure communication over the internet?
In JavaScript, what does the 'filter' method do when called on an array?
options: Creates a new array with elements that pass a test
questions.correctAnswer: Creates a new array with elements that pass a test

questions.questionText: Which HTML tag is used to create a hyperlink?
What is the purpose of the 'localStorage' object in JavaScript?
options: To store data persistently in the browser
To send data to a server
questions.correctAnswer: To store data persistently in the browser

questions.questionText: In CSS, which property controls the visibility of an element without removing it from the layout?
Which React hook is used to access the current URL or navigate programmatically?
What is the purpose of the 'robots.txt' file in a web application?
In JavaScript, what does the 'try-catch' block do?
Which CSS property is used to align items within a flex container?
What is the purpose of the 'defer' attribute in a <script> tag?
options: Loads the script after the HTML is parsed
questions.correctAnswer: Loads the script after the HTML is parsed

questions.questionText: Which HTTP status code indicates that a request is unauthorized?
In JavaScript, what is a 'closure'?
options: A function that retains access to its outer scope
questions.correctAnswer: A function that retains access to its outer scope

questions.questionText: Which HTML element is used to group related form inputs?
What does the CSS 'grid-template-columns' property define?
options: The number and size of grid columns
questions.correctAnswer: The number and size of grid columns

questions.questionText: In React, what is the purpose of the 'Context' API?
options: To share data across components without props
questions.correctAnswer: To share data across components without props
